title: Publications
text:
Learning From the Past with Cascading Eligibility Traces


Tokiniaina Raharison Ralambomihanta, Ivan Anokhin, Roman Pogodin, Samira Ebrahimi Kahou, Jonathan Cornford, Blake Aaron Richards


preprint, arxiv 2025


[PDF, Code]


We show how to handle delayed credit assignment in an online, bio-plausible fashion by employing SSMs to retain past activations. We demonstrate the applicability of our method on computer vision and RL tasks. The design is friendly to on-device learning and Streaming RL.







Handling Delay in Real-Time Reinforcement Learning


Ivan Anokhin, Rishav Rishav, Matthew Riemer, Stephen Chung, Irina Rish, Samira Ebrahimi Kahou


ICLR 2025


[PDF, Code, Blog post, Poster]


We address real-time RL by pipelining layer computations and handling observation delay. We show it leads to faster inference and competitive performance on MuJoCo and MinAtar. The design is also friendly to on-device inference.

title: Publications
text:
All publications


[1] T. R. Ralambomihanta, I. Anokhin, R. Pogodin, S. E. Kahou, J. Cornford, and B. A. Richards, ‚ÄúLearning from the past with cascading eligibility traces,‚Äù arXiv preprint arXiv:2506.14598, 2025.


[2] J. Chmura et al., ‚ÄúAIF-GEN: Open-source platform and synthetic dataset suite for reinforcement learning on large language models,‚Äù in Championing open-source DEvelopment in ML workshop@ ICML25, 


[3] I. Anokhin, R. Rishav, M. Riemer, S. Chung, I. Rish, and S. E. Kahou, ‚ÄúHandling delay in real-time reinforcement learning,‚Äù arXiv preprint arXiv:2503.23478, 2025.


[4] I. Anokhin, R. Rishav, S. Chung, I. Rish, and S. E. Kahou, ‚ÄúHandling delay in reinforcement learning caused by parallel computations of neurons,‚Äù in ICML 2024 workshop: Aligning reinforcement learning experimentalists and theorists, 


[5] S. Chung, I. Anokhin, and D. Krueger, ‚ÄúThinker: Learning to plan and act,‚Äù Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems, vol. 36, pp. 22896‚Äì22933, 2023.


[6] M. Velikanov et al., ‚ÄúEmbedded ensembles: Infinite width limit and operating regimes,‚Äù in International conference on artificial intelligence and statistics, PMLR, 2022, pp. 3138‚Äì3163.


[7] I. Anokhin, K. Demochkin, T. Khakhulin, G. Sterkin, V. Lempitsky, and D. Korzhenkov, ‚ÄúImage generators with conditionally-independent pixel synthesis,‚Äù in Proceedings of the IEEE/CVF conference on computer vision and pattern recognition, 2021, pp. 14278‚Äì14287.


[8] I. Anokhin et al., ‚ÄúHigh-resolution daytime translation without domain labels,‚Äù in Proceedings of the IEEE/CVF conference on computer vision and pattern recognition, 2020, pp. 7488‚Äì7497.


[9] I. Anokhin and D. Yarotsky, ‚ÄúLow-loss connection of weight vectors: Distribution-based approaches,‚Äù in International conference on machine learning, PMLR, 2020, pp. 335‚Äì344.

title: Hello, world
text:
This is a starter blog post. Quarto supports math like \(Q(s,a)\) and runnable code blocks.


Code
sum(i for i in range(5))


10


Add more posts by running:
quarto create post "my-next-post" --title "My next post"

title: Ivan Anokhin
text:
News

2025-10 - Launched this website! üéâ
2025-07 - Preprint on bio-plausible learning rule that handles delayed credit assignment is out! üéâ
2025-07 - Mila blog post on real-time RL is out.

title: Repository Guidelines
text:
Source pages: index.qmd (home), publications.qmd, posts in posts/<slug>/index.qmd.
Assets: images/ for media; bibliographic data in publications.bib.
Config: _quarto.yml controls site metadata, nav, and formats.
Build output: _site/ (published site). Build cache: _freeze/.





quarto preview: Run a local server with live reload at a local port.
quarto render: Build the full site into _site/.
quarto check: Verify required tooling and reveal missing dependencies.
Tip: Commit source (*.qmd, images/, _quarto.yml), not _site/ unless your deploy strategy requires it.





Content: Write in .qmd with YAML front matter (title, date, categories).
Indentation: 2 spaces for YAML and nested Markdown lists/code.
Slugs: Hyphenated lowercase (e.g., posts/hello-world/index.qmd).
Media: Place under images/, use descriptive names, add alt text.
Headings: Use sentence case; keep levels consistent (#, ##, ###).





Build cleanly: quarto render should complete without errors/warnings.
Link/content sanity: Use quarto preview to manually verify navigation, code blocks, and citations.
Environment: Run quarto check after upgrades or on new machines.





Commits: Prefer Conventional Commits (e.g., docs: add post on X, fix: correct broken link).
PRs: Include a concise description, screenshots for visual changes, and link related issues.
Verification: Show that quarto render succeeds locally; note any config changes in _quarto.yml.





Do not commit secrets or API keys; this site should be static.
Keep _quarto.yml minimal and documented; add comments near non-obvious options.
Large assets: optimize images before adding to keep builds fast.
